channel.title: Learning Java
channel.description:
Hey guys, sorry if this is in the wrong section. If it is, could someone point me towards the right section w/o flaming me?
Mkay. What I'm looking for is someone who knows what they're doing when coding. I've read tutorials on oracle.com, but I just don't seem to get them 100%. I get the basic stuff, like how fields are the state, while methods are the behavior of a software. I've also picked up that classes are basically the blueprints, or the base of a software, and the you must have a } for every {, and vice versa. (Correct me if I'm wrong on any of that).
But, I don't get 90% of what's being said in the tutorials (it's a beginer's tutorial), so I'm not picking much of it up. If anyone knows of some REALLY basic tutorials to just get me started, that would be great, but I think I need someone who's willing to help me out. If not, again, basic tutorials that are noob friendly could benifit me a lot I think.
Thanks guys.. (PS. I did the HelloWordApp thing too )

item.title: Learning Java
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:16, topic:387453”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=483257.msg3542887#msg3542887 date=1300994414]

havent seen any good guides / tutorials here on the internet ( which is strange )

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/
[/quote]

missed that one , still , i prefer practical training , messing around with stuff yourself and finding out what it does is more fun than having it all explained to you xD[/quote]
Yea, I agree. It is much more fun that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning Java
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

real - life lessons , havent seen any good guides / tutorials here on the internet ( which is strange )
try to learn what the different components are and what they do , javax.swing for example handles basic stuff such as JFrame , JLabels , buttons , etc…

or look at how a RSPS’s client is coded , that also helped me a bit

Read full topic

item.title: Learning Java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yup. I just had a string, “You\njust\nlost\nthe\ngame.”, and then for every byte in the string, & 0xFF, << 8; Then I took those values, but it into the int[], and then did >> 8, & 0x7F; Simple stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning Java
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“TimeBroken, post:7, topic:387453”]I’m confused. How did you get it to send the text “You fail at life.” ?[/quote]Because characters are actually 16bit values, so you can represent them with numbers. He shifted the numbers and displayed them

Read full topic
